website_summaries.verdict: This system helps tame dogs that like to get out of fences. It works well and is very easy to install.
pros: Gives you 4 levels of intensity to deal with dogs not responding to the fence
Can be used with an unlimited number of pets over 8 pounds
Unit simply plugs into an outlet
Customer service is there on Saturdays
cons: This system is not for small dogs or cats
It is recommended for use with pets over 30 pounds

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first week or so and then our dog started running and walking through it without getting shocked at all. No beep or shock, collar was on and everything was set up. Don’t know what happened but it was way too Unreliable and disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Near

customer_reviews.title: Toast after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in June and it’s already toast. The battery connections have come apart. With what these things cost, they should last more then 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Thaut

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Have a Husky. Doesn't work with him. He can care less about the shock at level 5. It worked for 1/2 a day and then he just ignores it.
customer_reviews.author: Oleg

customer_reviews.title: Did not come with battery
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used the collar yet, but I’m mad that I paid $80 for a collar that didn’t come with a battery.
customer_reviews.author: rachel f.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this product. I bought three of these collars in December and now in May they aren’t working. When we first got them they worked great but now I have changed the batteries in all three collars but they don’t beep, vibrate, or shock any more. These collars are only six months old and I spent over $500 dollars putting in the underground fence and buying these collars.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Last!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second collar that has completely died within 6-9 months of purchasing. New batteries don’t work, so I will have to replace this AGAIN. SO FRUSTRATING!
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey Heath

customer_reviews.title: HELPFUL TIP!
customer_reviews.text: We ended up having to return this, through no fault of the seller, we just needed to cover more acreage. The seller was great to work with though. The reason I'm submitting a review is to give this HELPFUL TIP: In order to create a passable boarder from the perimeter to the transmitter, you need to wrap the wires around each other 10-12 times per foot, which for us was about 50 feet. What we did was put the two wires in a drill (where the bit goes) and turned it on. It took less than a minute. They should put this suggestion in the manual.
customer_reviews.author: DoodleBugTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. The boundary with control has to be set to 5’ or over or else the systems warning beeps go off constantly. Then one morning we woke up to our poor dog being shocked constantly as though she were outside the fence. She was petrified. This is a complete waste of money, not to mention the wasted time it took to install. Don’t waste your money or time.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Not solving our problem...
customer_reviews.text: The reviews on this collar were all over the place, so I thought I'd give it a try. We breed Cavalier King Charles spaniels. A toy-sized spaniel! They are on a hard-wired electric fence. Except for the boy. He is intact, as he is our stud dog. He kept running through with the regular collar. This one hasn't slowed him down in the least. We have it jacked up to "electrocute" practically, but he just gets a running start and blows through it. This dog only weighs about 12 lbs! On the other hand, a regular non-stubborn dog collar will stop my 85 lb German Shepherd in his tracks. Go figure!
customer_reviews.author: BoyMom

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointing! DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these collars I bought a few years ago and loved it, set the fence up and all was well! Got a second dog so bought this collar to add to the fence. I noticed the name changed a bit and it's a different company but same collar. This collar only works for about a month before it doesn't anymore and you have no warning. My Rescue walked right out of the fence almost into the road! The original collar I bought still has the same battery after almost three years, this new one won't even last you a month. This is unsafe and waste of $$$ DO NOT PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.author: A. Mich

customer_reviews.title: Great for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: We've had these for over 20 years for our 4 acres to keep the dogs in. I noticed people complaining about the wires breaking. The battery wires are only 22 gauge so you have to be very careful when you replace the 9-volt battery any wire will break when you bend it back and forth particularly stranded copper. I have broken wires once and was able to solder it back. But not this time.
customer_reviews.author: B VanEmon

customer_reviews.title: what in the tarnation did I get?
customer_reviews.text: No tone, No vibration, No static correction. Batteries have been changed. I downloaded the owners manual for reference because NOTHING came with the collar. I literally mean nothing. No shock tester, no second set of prongs. This collar was literally just placed in an envelope and delivered. I cant believe I paid what I did for this damned thing. I have a second collar original to my PetSafe inground fence that still works, so I know there is no break in the line. I dont even know if I can return because I didnt even get original packaging... again, just the collar put in an envelope.
customer_reviews.author: Duckadoodledoo

customer_reviews.title: Don't forget the battery!
customer_reviews.text: This collar worked like it should work, and as I expected it to work. I purchased this collar to replace an aging collar I have. The old collar was around 10 years old. I don't know how long they're designed to last but the battery only lasted for a week. The only downside I have with this collar, the LED that illuminates when the battery is low in power, is on the bottom of the collar. You can't see the LED blinking when the dog is wearing the collar. The old collar's LED is on the front of the collar, visible when the collar is on the dog. But I am satisfied and the collar is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS PETSAFE COLLAR
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 3 of these more than 17 years ago. We had 3 German Shepherds back then. These collars kept them safe inside our acreage. The new ones have a slight upgrade than the older model. We also like the fact that we can buy our own 9v batteries and that it does not require expensive special batteries like some other models. We have never had any issues with the receivers breaking or not working. We have replaced the plastic that is under the prongs and the regular collars. You must spend time with your dogs and train them to learn the boundaries. We love this product and thank you Petsafe for keeping our dogs safe!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Works well, good price.
customer_reviews.text: My dog's collar came off in the yard and we didn't realize it or find it for days. He stays in his yard without the collar now, but after a week or so, he realizes he can inch closer and closer to his line. Bought this to replace it. He's a great dane and he hasn't had to be shocked with the collar for years. The alert sound happens first which makes him back away quickly. IF he continues, it will vibrate (he never gets that far). Then if he keeps going, it will shock. I do have a piece to test it out and it works great, but he stays in the yard so I just need the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlyn Garrison

customer_reviews.title: System works great! Tip for Easy Installation!
customer_reviews.text: It was a pain to install it, but the system works great. A quick tip for easy installation! Borrow or rent a rotary tiller and take off all the blades except one. Then you can just walk your path and have the entire trench dug up within 10% of the time it would take you to dig it with a shovel. Also, we had some contractors cut the line (even after I marked it with spray paint and told them about it). It was super easy to fix with the kit they send with the product (and it's only $10 to buy another kit if needed).
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated and still does not work
customer_reviews.text: Bought the fence and was excited to get it installed. Buried the wire and connected the transmitter, but the loop light did not come on and it beeped like there was a break. Spent another $70 to find the break locator kit and walked the fence line for 2 hours last night, but the signal is still transmitting so there is no break in the wire. Looks like a bad transmitter might be the issue, but very disappointed in the product as it still does not work and I have invested a considerable amount of time and money into this already..
customer_reviews.author: Sankesh P.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic fence
customer_reviews.text: This fence is fantastic! It works just as advertised. The only problem I’ve had is with lightening and you can’t stop it from happening. Customer service was wonderful and suggested I disconnect the fence transmitter during storms. The lightening increased the distance from the fence where the collar picks up the correction signal and it also makes the fence transmitter beep. Other than that, I love this fence, it keeps my dogs safely in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Mercury2042

customer_reviews.title: The collar won't stay tight around the dog's neck
customer_reviews.text: This works fine. The zapper unit is on the larger side because it uses a standard 9V battery. I like not having to buy special batteries. But, like I said...the collar won't stay tight. That should be able to be fixed easily by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Wight Mann

customer_reviews.title: We like
customer_reviews.text: These collars work very well with our Fence although the color material is not very sturdy and did not last very long we took one of our dog collars and put the device on that and it works very well and holds up I wish they would make the color itself a little thicker as our dog is very active and plays with other dogs in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Oden AK

customer_reviews.title: Amazing setup
customer_reviews.text: - Very Easy to install - Instructions are very thorough - Setup flags and train your dog on the perimeter for a while to teach them, (use tons of treats when they come back from the edge) - Live with out the haste of letting your dog out on a leash or paying for a massive fence. - I would highly recommend this system for anyone - We have two 8 month old labs that have done great with this system, just be patient with the training portion and they'll pick it up fast.
customer_reviews.author: JSimpkins

customer_reviews.title: NOT A straight forward install ... HOurs on line with tech support and had to buy extra line
customer_reviews.text: After hours and hours on line with tech support we had to purchase additional line and re run with a double back system... (there were 2 lines that had to be 5ft apart the entire perimeter) This is the only system that Ive had to do that with. While it does work fine it drastically reduced my dogs yard space because of the 5ft separation between lines. Tech support is only open during business hours m-f
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Bair

customer_reviews.title: It WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: The first set we purchased had split wires--return was quick and easy and we had a new one moments later. We also purchased a thicker gauge wire separately as well as twisted wire. It made the whole project more expensive, but installation was much easier and it should last a long time. Best of all, it works! Our escape artist is now well within the confines of her yard. Our wooden fence reinforced with wire didn't keep her in, but that extra little zap does!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle kustomer

customer_reviews.title: Tip For Stubborn Dogs
customer_reviews.text: This product has kept my dog in the yard and me worry free. I have a Husky Shepherd mix that has learned jump a 6 foot fence. On the lowest setting, he would still run through the shock and escape. My advice for those who have stubborn dogs or dogs with thicker coats, put the collar on its highest settings. After about two good shocks he learned the boundaries quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Keeps stubborn dogs in the yard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my dog was running through my fence barrier with ProLite 7K collar. I have a Professional Petsafe inground fence system. This collar works perfect with my system. I have a professional collar pro280 also.( The only real difference is that the professional collar has 10 settings where the stubborn dog has 5 settings). I am very pleased that the stubborn dog worked with my system as the price was substantially less. I don’t necessarily like the collar it came with as it slips to a larger size on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Man

customer_reviews.title: Receiver is great but the collar is the weak point
customer_reviews.text: The receiver works as advertised, lasts a long time, and is reliable. The collar, however, has a habit of coming loose on its own. Fortunately, the receiver can be removed and fixed onto any regular collar with a little work. I would have given it 5 stars but what's the point of having a collar receiver if it's just going to eventually come loose and fall off?
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Made a Huge Difference.
customer_reviews.text: Works so far. We had the basic rechargeable collar that came with a petsafe kit. Our German Shepherd pup would take even the highest shock level (5), to follow is into the woods beyond the fenceline. While nobel, I worry shed do that chasing an animal to the road. We moved up to the Stubborn Dog and she's respecting the fenceline now. Was not a fan of using a shock but I have lost 2 dogs outsmarted my physical fences and ran on to the local state highway. Dogs are smart learn the boundaries quickly. With warning beeps from the collar they are reminded and rarely actually get zapped.
customer_reviews.author: JackRoacher

customer_reviews.title: Zaps dog while inside house!!
customer_reviews.text: The first one I bought at Lowe's lasted quite awhile and then all of the sudden one side of the black box popped off so we had to order this one. NOW< this one suddenly started going off when my beautiful dog went into the office where he sleeps. Now he's afraid to go to sleep and when I contact support, they were no help at all. After reading online reviews, this isn't the first time this has happened. I wish they supported their product better.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: It’s huge & heavy!! My dog got a painful ugly rash from wearing it and ended up at vet with a severe infection and strap needed to be replaced :( now he’s on meds and can’t wear a collar for 2 weeks. We were told by vet to only put collar on when he’s going outside and take off as soon as he comes in house. We also have it at highest level and my dog occasionally runs through it anyway so I’m not sure it works any better than the regular petsafe invisible fence collar.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: I love it when it works but I wish it worked consistently
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this July 2017 and when it works it is great, unfortunately, it has worked inconsistently. It will lose the connection to the loop randomly. Only once have I had an actual issue with the wire. All of the other times I will unplug it for a day or two then plug it back it and it will work fine for a day, two days, sometimes a month, and then the cycle starts all over again... Disappointed that this in-ground fence is such high maintenance...
customer_reviews.author: Tonia Miller

customer_reviews.title: My dog almost got hurt trying to get over the ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog almost got hurt trying to get over the fence when she thought I was going to leave. Bought this, so she could hang out in the back yard when i'm gone. Read the instructions and seemed very overwhelming, especially during remodeling. Waited to long to return. Will attempt to install(if I don't just change from chain link to wood fence first),when more remodeling is done. I need to make it so she won't leave the backyard, but will be able to come in and out of the doggy door. I will learn to waych more online videos before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia T.

customer_reviews.title: Most effective for area covered and variety of breeds!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this collar for all 4 of our dogs - two Border collies, and two Livestock guardian dogs. Their fur types range from sleek and thin, to very thick layers. With a little trimming for the heavy coated coats, this collar has effectively kept them all at home. The fence works well for our 7+ acres, and we have a friend who uses it for 15 acres. It was easy to attach to our existing fence. We put it about 2 feet up from the ground, and placed it in PVC pipe to go beneath the gates.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Hnatovic

customer_reviews.title: Change your battery!
customer_reviews.text: Part fault of my own, but between life and having a newborn totally forgot these run on batteries. There is not easy way to see the low battery light if it even has one, that being said didnt realize my battery was low, was still making sound but not actually shocking, which my dog found out and ultimately led to her getting out of the parameter. I'm not blaming the collar on her getting hit, but maybe if there way a better light or placed on more assessable side, I may have noticed it was low before it was too late. So overall I guess "it work" just change your battery often!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Jobe

customer_reviews.title: Great Product(when you actually get this product) but Wrong Product Delivered
customer_reviews.text: Works great, except when they send you the wrong product. I had purchased one of these previously with the pack and it works great (works even after being rained and frozen), so no complaints there. The only issue is that I then ordered two of these individually and they sent me the rechargeable version (only lasts for 3 weeks or less at a time) obviously not what is displayed here, and is not near as useful as the 9V version. Also would strongly suggest putting some reflective tape or fabric on the collar, so if it gets pulled off, you can just wait till dark and go look with a flashlight.
customer_reviews.author: M. Little

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your Dogs
customer_reviews.text: We already had the electric fence and dogs that had collars. We purchased this collar for an addition to the famil. It is a great collar, easily adjustable, sturdy and battery last a long time. There are several setting to choose from as well. Our dogs had no problem adjusting to the color and the boundary lines for the fence. Great Product
customer_reviews.author: april maynor

customer_reviews.title: works better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried all kinds of options, but this worked the best for us and our dogs. Buried the wire around the perimeter, put the collars on, the dogs got the message. Now I can let them out without the collars and both our dogs do not go near the perimeter, a couple of shocks did the trick. I use the collars still, but do not use all the time, only occasional for reinforcement just in case, but my pups remember.
customer_reviews.author: Borider

customer_reviews.title: Effective roaming preventative.
customer_reviews.text: It's been awhile since I bought this, but well worth it. Installed to keep my dog close to home & alive. Too many dogs get run over because irresponsible people don't keep them close enough to home. She knows we can roam around when the collar is off, but for her safety, she wears the collar & has plenty of yard to play in when I'm away.
customer_reviews.author: Ronb

customer_reviews.title: Pet Smart stubborn Dog In-Ground Fence
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Pet Smart Stubborn Dog in ground fence product and received it 3 days later. Upon opening the box everything in it was exactly as shown on the Amazon product description. The directions should be read through a couple of times. The installation was simple and straight forward. We have a giant breed dog who is very stubborn and had issues jumping the fence. This product proved exactly what we needed to stop this issue. I would recommend this to all who ask.
customer_reviews.author: joseph locastro

customer_reviews.title: Stopped a Dane in heat dead in her tracks
customer_reviews.text: Our dog was blowing through our fence with the normal collar whenever she felt it was worth the penalty. First time she tried it with this one was the last time. It has stopped her at a full run dead in her tracks. If it works on a dog her size, I can't imagine it not stopping anything short of a horse.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Taught my old dog a new trick
customer_reviews.text: We have a 12 year old mixed breed, who is hard of hearing. No fence to keep him in the yard. Installation wasn't too bad, hard to bury wire around the tree roots that are close to the surface. In those areas used some lawn staples to keep the wire down. Overall, we are about 3 weeks in and my dog now knows the boundaries. I have kept the flags up so he has a visual of where to stop. We are pleased with this product and happy that our old guy can roam around without us having to watch him like a hawk!
customer_reviews.author: K. Easton

customer_reviews.title: Working great for our escape artist!
customer_reviews.text: This system came as as recommendation from a neighbor with a huge hint: follow the training steps exactly and don't rush it! We did just that and have a trained dog. One that came from the human society as a bolter and highly distracted by people and dogs walking by our house. We took the time at each stage, even making some last a bit longer until we were confident. We'd highly recommend this as a more affordable option for a dog fence.
customer_reviews.author: MichiganGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great product, price and shortest delivery time ever.
customer_reviews.text: These are the only collers I buy, because I have large dogs and it keeps them in the yard even when the neighbors dogs run free and mine want to participate. I have had to replace them a few times, but I expect that. This is the quickest I have ever received my orders from anyone, EVER! I ordered 3 am Saturday morning and it was here bright and early Sunday morning. I can't say enough good things about this seller. The product was brand new in a sealed package,at a great price, and lightening fast delivery. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Me and My Shadow

customer_reviews.title: very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!!! This is a very cost effective solution if you need a fence for your pet. I live on one acre and have barbed wire fence on two sides of the property. With the help of a tractor w/ a small plow blade, I was able to bury two sides and run the rest of the perimeter along the bottom strand of barbed wire in about half a day. Our dog required minimal training and has not "escaped" the property. I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Wire on the spool arrives twisted and knotted!
customer_reviews.text: Ok first let me say I am still in the install process. We rented a cable installer (trencher) to install the wire. Unfortunately we didn’t get more than 50 ft trenched before we ran into a snag with the wire. You would think the wire is spooled so it unravels from the spool in one continuous feed right?? But NO!! It was wrapped in on itself twisted together so that the only way to use it is to unwind the spool completely onto something else. THAT’S not in the instructions. 1.5 hours later we are still trying to unravel this &@#%mess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very defective
customer_reviews.text: No part of this has worked for us. There are inconsistent “breaks” in the fence allowing our puppy to get out at random spots sometimes, but not others. Sometimes he will get out then it will not let him back in. There is one whole section that never works where he gets out consistently. He is a 10 week old puppy and sometimes when it does shock he acts like he doesn’t feel anything, and we have it turned all the way up. My husband has fiddled with it many times and the issues just change.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rough take off
customer_reviews.text: I had a difficult time getting it hooked up correctly w/ the wire fence, but once I figured it out, it’s been working great.
customer_reviews.author: schreff

customer_reviews.title: These really work
customer_reviews.text: We've used a radio fence in training our dogs for 20 years. It REALLY works. Our most recent acquisition from the humane society is a 5-year old golden retriever. We upgraded to the stubborn dog model and she learned the property boundaries immediately. No pain....audible warning and she's running to the door.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma4times

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: We have one that covers 2 acres and it keeps our large pack of 6 dogs contained. When my son got his dog, I Bought this for him so his collar will work on our fence when they visit. Collars are adjustable allowing us to customize for each dogs temperament.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lamet

customer_reviews.title: I bought two of these
customer_reviews.text: These were to replace the little boxes that my dogs destroyed as they were wrestling and I have to say that these stubborn boxes are far more superior than the normal collar receivers that come with the in the ground kit.
customer_reviews.author: Wunce 1

customer_reviews.title: Love the 9 volt!
customer_reviews.text: Purchase for use on second dog, the 9 volt battery is much more affordable option than the special battery. Like all the collars it is adjustable strength so you can use it on low power for non-stubborn dogs without any worries of hurting them.
customer_reviews.author: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Easy installation.
customer_reviews.text: My Great Pyrenees/Anatolian Sheppard mix responded very well right away. He is as stubborn as he is big and I was worried this wouldn't keep him contained. I set it at 4 and started to train him where the boundaries were. Just I thought he would, he tried to go through the flags. As soon as he felt it vibrate he backed away. The second time he ran full speed into the correction zone. He stopped dead in his tracks when he felt the correction and immediately came back into the safe zone. Ever since then, won't go past the warning. Would recommend it to anyone looking for a inexpensive solution for a fence.
customer_reviews.author: Amber I

customer_reviews.title: This product is fantastic! I adopted a dog that likes to chase ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic! I adopted a dog that likes to chase cars. After spending lots of time and money re-fencing our 2 1/2 acre yard, the neighbor's dogs kept digging under it and ours would follow him out. We opted to install the wire along the fences, going underground only at gates. After the second day, I only had to give the verbal command "stay back" and my dogs backed away from the fence. After 30 days, we are able to open the gate and the dogs will go only so close to it and sit down and wait for us to return. They have made no effort to get out at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money for your Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: My poodle kept escaping the yard by squeezing underneath the fence. I'd pull up to my neighborhood only to find him wandering around several blocks from my house, in the roads and in danger of cars. Purchasing this was the best thing for him. He learned very quickly not to even approach the fence and when I'm away, he stays safely in the yard. It's a bit expensive for such a little device, but you can't put a price on peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes him behave
customer_reviews.text: I have a large american bully who is cute but not really bright that comes to visit from time to time. He loves to pull at my neighbor's chain link fence. Just so happens they have an existing PetSafe fence install. Despite his thickness, mentally and physically, this collar had stopped the fence destruction cold.
customer_reviews.author: Pam S

customer_reviews.title: doesn’t link to electric fence
customer_reviews.text: This collar was not easy to work with. I followed the instructions which didn’t do anything more than help me install a battery. Not the battery that was needed either. It had no direction on how to connect the fence to make it active. This may be a “me” thing but I was never able to use it. Better off going thought peltsafe.com directly.
customer_reviews.author: JENNIFER RHODE

customer_reviews.title: Go big or go home
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your time with the smaller one. This is the one your dog needs to learn with. Used this on my Brittany and she weighs 50 lbs. she learned fast with this one. She would run through the other smaller one.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Range was very fickle. Sometimes collar would start beeping ...
customer_reviews.text: Range was very fickle. Sometimes collar would start beeping inside the house and randomly stop. The collar that comes with it is cheaper than a hair tie but you can take the shocker off and put it on a different collar. My dog never picked up the concept and just sat in the bathroom corner paranoid all day so I dont use it anymore. The stubborn aspect did nothing. Highest setting she just ran through, yelped until she was gone and kept going. Never picked up the flags being a boundery for her.
customer_reviews.author: Backwell

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement transceiver but the collar is weak
customer_reviews.text: I am using this receiver daily with the SDF-100A and works just fine. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because the collar is too weak and cheap to hold the bulk of the unit. You need a firmer collar or the thing twists easily and reverses the receiver and the probes do not make good contact. The receiver works just as good as the receiver that came with my SDF-100A. This unit saves you $20 over the msrp of the replacement for the SportsDog version. I ended up purchasing a better collar so I really did not save any money purchasing this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Blessing

customer_reviews.title: Pet safe fence
customer_reviews.text: It took us several hours to lay the wire and we had to have an electrican come and finish the wiring. The collar is way to large for our little dog! You need a much smaller style collar to be offered. Your customer service center is very helpful and so friendly. I sure appreciated that!
customer_reviews.author: Mary sue Ensing

customer_reviews.title: Good transmitter, basic collar.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to add a second dog to the system. The transmitter is very sturdy. The collar itself...eh, it's okay. I ended up buying 2 different additional collars and fitting the transmitters to them. I have 2 rambunctious young dogs who weigh about 65 pounds each and love to wrestle. So there is no way the pet safe collar material would last. You're really paying for the transmitter anyway so I feel like this is still a good product. My only suggestion would be to add sturdier options for the collars themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Eclectic Shopper

customer_reviews.title: The system itself works great, it's just that our Pyrenees is stubborn lol
customer_reviews.text: The system itself works great, it's just that our Pyrenees is stubborn lol....which is common of the breed. One thing though, if your dog runs past the boundary you'll need to unplug the system in order to get your dog back into the boundary, otherwise, it'll shock'em.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H

customer_reviews.title: Works but could use some updating
customer_reviews.text: This product works but given the amount you pay PetSafe could make some changes to help justify the cost. I do not like the fact that this product requires a 9V battery that has to be changed out by unscrewing the case. Additionally, there is not thing on the product that will give you an idea of how much charge is still left on the battery. It is also extremely bulky. This product could be SO much better if they would switch to a lithium ion rechargeable battery. Lithium ion would reduce the size and make recharging fast and affordable. Also, given the low energy consumption and cost associated with LED a battery meter of some kind would be excellent!
customer_reviews.author: BestPersonYouKnow

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I thought i would be changing batteries every month or so. The original battery has lasted more than 6 months. However, my 130lb dog learned very quickly to not trigger it. Much better than the old rechargeable one i had.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Reid

customer_reviews.title: Product works but not as good as my older collars.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an add on to my existing system. This new collar does not pick up my underground fence as well as my other, much older collars. One of my collars is 8 years old and performs much better than this new collar. Also, the audible beep on this collar is not a loud as on the older collars. Makes training a new dog difficult. I actually just ended up putting this new collar on a trained dog and used the old collar that I had to train the new dog. Working much better that way.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to our problem pup!
customer_reviews.text: Our 65 pound black lab was getting out of our "fenced" area and running around. We tried the long prongs on the basic collar and change the battery regularly however it didn't work. This collar is a bit bulky but doesn't bother Mac at all. There are lots of settings including a strength setting for the shock and a vibration warning. We've had it a few months now and it's working great! Solved the problem immediately after his first and only shock on setting 3. We are extremely happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt's Mom

customer_reviews.title: This thing works!
customer_reviews.text: We have stubborn dog, and he definitely respects this fence. We change battery once a month to be safe. Collar module is a little large but doesn't seem to be an issue for the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: No strong correction
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work at the different correction levels. . We have used petsafe products for 18 years and have had stubborn dog collars in the past that work as described. Set on the highest setting, it only chirps and barely vibrates. The collars are not a deterrent for our spirited 7 month old.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Spool holding boundary wire fell apart leaving me with a tangled mess.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an earlier PetSafe fence on an existing decorative fence. When I was about 2/3 done on the perimeter, the spool holding the wire fell apart causing a hopeless tangle. I had to cut out sections of wire and make connections with what I could find. This was a major aggravation. I have 100 feet of hopelessly tangled wire. I have cursed your company many times. Get a functional spool and add a few bucks to the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Gates

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this product to anyone that has a dog. I have 4 hunting dogs and ever since I got the collars they have stayed right in their boundries. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Annette M Mongar

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt come with what you need
customer_reviews.text: Just a heads up to buyers....doesnt come with cords/cables or even the hardware. You have to provide your own screws! Super big pain, especially since we bought it when the weather was poor, and by the time we opened it, the return window had closed (by 4 days)
customer_reviews.author: jill high

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace an in-ground dog fence I had for more than 10 years after lightning fried it. This one works great and was easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: ACK80

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Radio Fence Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I have many dogs and all of them (big and small) wear these. They're a little large and clunky, however they have some great features: 1) there's a little red light that flashes when the battery is low; 2) they take 9V batteries instead of proprietary or unusually sized batteries; 3) the batteries last forever (for me at least, many months between changes). I have completely stopped using the other receivers because they don't seem to last as long (they fail more often), use proprietary or less-than-common batteries, and some of my smarter dogs have learned to ignore them. Very few of these receivers have failed, although it happens occasionally. All in all a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin

customer_reviews.title: Dont pay this much it's not worth it
customer_reviews.text: For some reason I cant get the height to adjust to my dog. I have a mastador and her neck is about to my waste and I've tried multiple times to reset it. I have a loop system to block off part of my yard and it's in ground 5' apart and still doesn't work. It works for part of the yard but not all so idk. But I recommend getting something else or a better brand because I'm disappointed that a $160 system isnt worth it :/
customer_reviews.author: michael bowles

customer_reviews.title: I didn't like the collar (the clips are plastic and could break ...
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one, (first one came with kit). It's still working strong. I didn't like the collar (the clips are plastic and could break after time), so we drilled holes in a different one we got from Walmart and put the receiver on it.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Works well with my sport dog 100 acre system.
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my sport dog 100 acre system. I like this collar more than the original because it clips on and off easily. However, I like the support provided by the sport dog wide plastic collar. In either case, the collar works well.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Dog safety
customer_reviews.text: Had problems with small collar. This was the answer to my dog running off. Love my dog and want him safe in the yard. This collar was the answer. He runs around and enjoys the freedom of the yard. I know he's safe, no worries
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great collar
customer_reviews.text: Quality is great. Built tough, works great. We are training a 10 week old Doberman puppy and are not ready to put on her “real” shock collar, so this fits the bill perfectly. I am able to set it without shock for training and will be able to add shock when necessary. Highly recommend this collar.
customer_reviews.author: Karmen

customer_reviews.title: Great Collar
customer_reviews.text: Its a great collar and highly recommend it if you have a little bit stubborn dog you need to keep in! Works great on my big dogs! Battery last forever too!
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Seems great so far.
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a replacement for the standard petsafe collar. I have an unground fence in addition to a real fence to keep in my dog who loves to dog under. So far with this one he hasn't been digging and hasn't escaped yet. I love the fact that this takes regular batteries as opposed to the special screw in kind because my other collar no longer held the batteries in so I had to tape them in to stay on. This is much bulkier than the regular collar.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Childs

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Just what’s needed for a stubborn dog, my dog would get a running start and go under the fence. Not so now though. He tries but no success because it pops a lot harder than the original and now he doesn’t even try. Problem solved!!
customer_reviews.author: Bobc

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my girlfriend as a Christmas gift. Her 80lb, 2 year old German Shepherd quickly learned the boundaries and seems to enjoy his new freedom of not being walked on a leash all of the time. A few times she has forgotten put the collar on before letting him out and he still will not cross the boundary. She takes the collar off at night because leaving it on for long periods of time can irritate a dogs skin. I chose a day in early March for installation as the ground was very soft after thawing out. Had it fully installed with nearly 500 feet of wire in the ground after 4 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S.

customer_reviews.title: keep your dog inside the fence with this collar.
customer_reviews.text: This collar saved our dogs. We have Sheppard pups who at almost a year old realized that they could jump a 6 foot fence. Our neighbors were horrified that a big dog could jump the fence. One neighbor said we should give the dogs away because we could not control them. We kept the dogs inside until this collar and fence arrived. It worked very well and install was not that hard for 2 people.
customer_reviews.author: US4

customer_reviews.title: Collar stopped working
customer_reviews.text: The collar and boundry system works great, until the collar itself stopped working. Changed battery, still not working. (it isn't a battery issue) I purchase 3 collars in total and all worked great. But one collar failed. The product suppost ran out a month ago, seems convienant. Hopefully my other two collars don't do the same in less then a year of use.
customer_reviews.author: D Holland

customer_reviews.title: These used to be good
customer_reviews.text: I have several very large dogs and these collars are the only thing that keeps them from going over the chain link fence. I've used them for years and always been very happy with them, but the last few I have gotten have not lasted more than a year or two. They all break the same way. The cover cracks around where the o-ring goes and then they get water in them and that's it. Too bad such a great product was destroyed by a dumb production decision.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Graham

customer_reviews.title: Fixed a jumping/digging issue
customer_reviews.text: Tried a 6foot physical fence tried horse wire and nothing kept our malamute in. Installed this and did a few days of training and bam he doesn’t jump the fence anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Worst collar ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst collar ever! no light so you cant even see if the battery is dead and it wont even work with my pet safe in-ground system! Only buy the petsafe stubborn in-ground collar. i have 2 danes and and when i got a new dane my husband bought this one (Big Mistake) have always used petsafe but this certain collar doesn't work the petsafe stubborn collar has a light and work perfect!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works great..butttttt...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, keeps my large lab puppy (whose 7 month old) in the yard no problem after some training. However, the plastic plugs get ruined easily, and the screws pop out all the time. Other then that, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. FULLER

customer_reviews.title: It’s working! Keeping the dog on our side of the fence!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! I have a nosey Irishdoodle that jumps like a springer spaniel. We have a fence and she hops it like a champ. The electric fence keeps her on our property. You can adjust the correction which I love.
customer_reviews.author: massagemama

customer_reviews.title: Cheap pink collar
customer_reviews.text: The product itself works great - keeps our stubborn dog in the yard, BUT make sure you put it on another collar - this pink cheap thing will come unhooked (we live out in the country and couldn't find where he lost 2 (!) of them.) Expensive to replace when all you need is a better collar that won't come unhooked. I bought a better collar and literally poked holes in it to make it work. Has also come off in the yard when he was rough-housing with other dogs. All in all, over four years we have bought FOUR collars. Don't trust the pink one... Otherwise, it will keep your dog in the yard!
customer_reviews.author: Duffy

customer_reviews.title: "And down the street they went..."
customer_reviews.text: Sorry PetSafe, bring back your old line of Ultra contain and train and we'll talk. Besides being too large these collars did zero to prevent our dogs (who NEVER walked through your old products fence) from roaming the neighborhood. I'd go back to Innotek that actually made your old, rebranded, product and have them make you new stuff. No, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: cBurgessc

customer_reviews.title: Stubborn dog no more.
customer_reviews.text: The 9 volt batter is a nice feature. It lasts a long time, even when the dog lingers at the fence line. Noted there is not much difference in thin battery life between the stubborn dog and the easy going dog. But when upgrade to the 9 volt the stubborn dog last about 3 months and the easy going do lasts about a year (Li 9 volt). The stubborn dog is very active. The original collar didn't last long. I replaced the original collar with a heavy duty nylon collar. I melted holes in the collar and attached the shock device with a tie wrap. 2 - 40 to 50 lb Samoyed 2 acre fenced in area
customer_reviews.author: Dwight Smith

customer_reviews.title: doesn't always deter my dog.
customer_reviews.text: if my dog wants out of the yard bad enough, me driving by to work etc., she does not let the shock stop her. she'll scream but got right on through.
customer_reviews.author: booklady

customer_reviews.title: pet fence
customer_reviews.text: This fence works great, at least for my golden retriever. I have had it for about 3 weeks now and I haven't even needed to set it to 'stun'. Just the beeping when he gets close to the line, makes him turn around and head back to the house. I buried over 1000 feet of wire which took most of a weekend, so it isn't the easiest thing in the world to do, but well worth the effort as my dog hasn't left the yard since. I haven't left him out all day unattended yet, but I'm fairly certain it will do the trick and keep him from running off like he did before.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Love the under ground fence but the quality of the collar isn’t great.
customer_reviews.text: We just bought a replacement collar. The clasp is not the best. It keeps popping open. Guess we will need to get a different collar and put the receiver on it.
customer_reviews.author: Norma L. Heidrich

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy used.
customer_reviews.text: Thought buying it used was going to safe me money but worse idea don’t buy used ...took hrs to install due to damaged wire..all the wires were cut and had to solder each broken wire.. product works great other than that.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I have a Jack Russel and a Toy Fox Terrier that were always wandering out towards the road. I installed this fence and I do not have to worry about them when outside anymore. They learned the boundaries quickly and stay within them even when the collars are off. The only complaint I would have is that the receiver on the collar is very large. A smaller size would be great for small dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Dennise

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It’s a shock collar. Can’t say much else about it. The last one I had like this lasted 4 years. I hope this one does as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rhys Royal

customer_reviews.title: Dogs contained and safe
customer_reviews.text: I have used this system for years. With a little training this has given my dogs 2.5 acres to roam. After training the dogs never leave the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Phillips

customer_reviews.title: great unit
customer_reviews.text: for a lab and greyhound mix he is smart and stubborn. he knows when it is not working and he is over a 5 ft fence. had this unit for over two yrs now. I had to order a new unit because the prone on the unit broke off and the screw to the prone broke of in the unit. Had to take dog to kennels while I wait for the new one. or he will be over the fence again. living in the woods and he just wants to run and not come home. unit works great.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra R.

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: We got the entire fence put in and it doesn’t work. My husband contacted customer service and told them we needed a replacement collar. They took 2 weeks and sent us something that was supposed to fix it! We just got it and it still doesn’t work. We now have to cal them again and request the collar! It’s been 2 months! Don’t bother buying this product it doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Jcutton

product_meta.title: PetSafe Stubborn Dog In-Ground Fence for Dogs and Cats - from the Parent Company of INVISIBLE FENCE Brand – Multiple Wire Gauge Options
product_meta.description:
Size:500 ft (1/3 Acre)| Style:20 Gauge Wire Kit

Keep your determined dog safe and secure during outdoor play without worry. The PetSafe Stubborn Dog In-Ground Fence is a do-it-yourself weekend project for most yard shapes and sizes. In this kit you will receive 500 feet of wire to create up to a 1/3-acre area to keep your dog safe and secure. With the purchase of additional wire, you can contain up to a 25-acre yard. This in-ground fence comes with 1 PetSafe Stubborn Dog In-Ground Fence Receiver Collar that fits dogs who weigh 8 pounds or more and adjusts to fit neck sizes between 6-28 inches. The waterproof, battery-operated collar has a tone plus vibration mode and 4 levels of adjustable static correction at a higher intensity correction level for hard-to-train pets. This system includes a unique run-through prevention to help keep your dog from running through their set boundary. If they attempt to run through, the static correction level will increase to encourage your dog to stay inside their safe play space. If you have more than 1 pet at home, simply purchase as many additional compatible receiver collars as you need so all of your pets can use the same system. With just 2 short weeks of training, your best friend will enjoy roaming and exploring their new yard! PetSafe brand is here to help you and your pet live happy together.



Kit Includes

 * Transmitter with power adaptor
 * 1 stubborn dog adjustable receiver collar
 * Surge protector
 * 50 training flags
 * 500 feet of wire
 * Waterproof splice capsules and wire nuts
 * 1 set of short and long contact points for short or long haired pets
 * Test light tool
 * Operating and training guide
 * One year warranty



Compatible Receiver Collars

 * Stubborn Dog In Ground Fence Receiver Collar (PRF 275 19) - Included with this system
 * UltraLight In Ground Fence Receiver Collar (PUL 275)
 * Little Dog In Ground Fence Receiver Collar (PIG19 11042)
 * Rechargeable In Ground Fence Receiver Collar (PIG00 13737)
 * In Ground Fence Receiver Collar for Cats (PCF 275 19)



Need Additional Information?

Let our U.S -based pet product experts help. We're available Monday through Saturday to answer your questions at 1-800-845-3274.

PetSafe brand has been a trusted global leader in pet behavior, containment and lifestyle innovations for nearly 30 years. We help pets and their people live happily together.
feature_bullets: 1/3 acre coverage: 500 feet of included wire lets you contain up to a 1/3-acre yard; Purchase additional wire to contain up to 5-acres
For stubborn dogs: 4 levels of adjustable static correction and a tone plus vibration mode help keep the most persistent dogs safe and secure inside their designated play area
For hearing impaired pets: Vibration mode on the receiver collar makes this a great option for pets who have trouble hearing
Fits most yards: This do-it-yourself weekend project lets you create an in-ground fence designed to fit your yard
Over correction protection: An automatic safety shut-off feature will keep your pet from receiving extended static correction if they remain in the correction zone for 30 seconds
Waterproof receiver collar: The included lightweight, waterproof collar fits pets weighing 8 pounds or more with neck sizes between 6-28 inch
Contain all your pets: With the purchase of additional collars, this in-ground fence system allows you to safely contain an unlimited number of pets
Compatibility: Works with all PetSafe in-ground fence receiver collars except YardMax receiver collars
U.S based customer care: Let our pet product experts help

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
